title: Confirmation Bias As Misfire Of Normal Bayesian Reasoning
summary:
Key ideas
- An evo psych explanation is proposed for confirmation bias
- Instinctive bias in favor of in-group worldview is deeply ingrained in human psychology
- Confirmation bias can be seen as a tendency to stick to what we already believe and reject evidence against it
- Anti-vaxxers are carrying out normal reasoning, but failing due to weighing evidence too lightly

Key learnings
- Confirmation bias can be seen as a normal form of reasoning
- The failure of confirmation bias can be seen as weighing new evidence too lightly

Key questions
- What is the difference between normal reasoning and confirmation bias?
- Why do people overweight priors?
- Is there a special type of reasoning that locks down priors more tightly?
